Detailed Description

Represents a message box which may contain any kind of text. If the text does not fit into the available are, it is possible to scroll through text with the up- and down-keys. For closing the message box a user interaction is required.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
 

Enumerator:
ID 

Reimplemented from Window.

enum MessageBox::ReturnId
 

Specifies the selection of the user.

Enumerator:
OkId  User selected Ok.
CancelId  User selected Cancel.
YesId  User selected Yes.
NoId  User selected No.

enum MessageBox::Type
 

Specifies the type of the message box.

Enumerator:
Ok  User can accept the message only by a OK. Note concerning usability: In this case it is better to use an Alert.
OkCancel  Ok and Cancel are offered.
YesNo  Yes and No are offered.

INT MessageBox::Open (  const WCHAR *  title = 0,
const WCHAR *  message = 0
)  [virtual]
 

Opens the message box modal and allows to set the title and text.

Parameters:
title Text of the message box title.
message Text of the message box content.
Returns:
Returns the corresponding MessageBox::ReturnId of the user selection.

BOOLEAN MessageBox::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Used by Aragon to read out the windows property out of the resource parser. It is not allowed for an application developer to invoke this method in a direct manner.

Reimplemented from Window.
